turn.0: ELI5: What does it mean to ground yourself?
turn.2: thanks for the answer much appriciated!!
turn.3: Bonus interesting fact: the definition of the Earth in electrical physics is "an object so large that its electrical charge does not change, no matter how much charge you give it". :)
turn.4: wait so lets say there is a massive piece of metal and you put like 1,000,000 volts into it its charge wont change?
turn.5: It probably will, even if it's a very massive piece of metal, like an aircraft carrier.  But the Earth is so big that you can put a million volts into it, and there won't be a measurable change in its charge.
turn.6: ah okay yeah that makes sense
